N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 622.2 - Travel to and from temporary residence

State Regulations
A trainee whose regular place of residence is beyond
commuting distance from the training facility, and who establishes a temporary
residence nearer to the facility, shall receive: (a) A transportation allowance for his travel
at the beginning and end of the training course: (1)
in an amount equal to the least expensive
means of public transportation by common carrier reasonably available to him
or, (2)
if there is no such public
transportation that can reasonably meet his needs, in an amount calculated by
multiplying by five cents the mileage of the most direct route from his regular
to his temporary residence. (b) A transportation allowance for return to
his regular residence for one or more nights during the training course in
amounts and under conditions as set forth under (a) above, except that: (1)
the allowance for each round-trip may be
reduced by 50 cents, with a maximum reduction of $2.50 for several round trips
during the same week and
(2)
the
allowance shall not exceed the subsistence allowance which would have been
payable if the trainee had remained at his temporary residence. Notes
